isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Diagnostic Software Operation - Diagnostic Tests - Injector Disable Tests

note.para: The Injector Disable tests can only be done with the EST; MasterDiagnostics® software is required.

svcprocinfo.para: The Injector Disable tests allows the technician to shut off injectors to determine if a specific cylinder is contributing to engine performance. Injectors can be shut off one at a time, alternative cylinders at a time or alternative cylinders plus one.
Alternate cylinders are every other cylinder in firing order.

When all cylinders are active, the contribution of each cylinder is 17% of its overall effect to maintain governed speed. When three cylinders are shut off, contribution of each remaining cylinder is 33% of its overall effect to maintain governed speed. The technician should monitor fuel rate and engine load.

note.para: The Relative Compression test should be done after doing the Injector Disable test to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problem.
Before doing the Auto test or Manual test for injector disable, make sure Performance Diagnostics tests 1 through 10 were completed and the following conditions are maintained:

item.para: Make sure accessories are turned off (for example: engine fan and air conditioning). Items cycled during this test could corrupt the test results.
Maintain engine idle.
Keep EOT within a 2 °C (5 °F) range from the beginning to the end of the test. EOT affects injection timing; too much of a change in EOT temperature could corrupt the test results.

note.para: If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 20 miles before checking for misfire or rough idle.

svcsubproc.title: Automatic Test
svcsubproc.para: The Automatic test is best used when comparing cylinder to cylinder test data.

note.para: If MasterDiagnostics® software does not have the Automatic test (auto run feature), see "Injector Disable - Manual test - Engine Hot" later in this section for procedure to compare cylinder to cylinder.
Do KOER Standard test before doing this test.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following: When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral or park, and the wheels are blocked.

note.para: If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 20 miles before checking for misfire or rough idle.

step1.para: While engine is running, select D_KOER_IDT_I6.ssn from the open session file window and select OPEN to open the session.
Select Diagnostics from menu bar.
Select I6 Injector Disable Tests from drop down menu.

note.para: The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.
However, when diagnosing a cold misfire, a technician can listen to tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine is at 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

step1.para: Select Auto Run.

note.para: While running the engine listen for tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.
If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 20 miles before checking for misfire or rough idle.

figure.caption: I6 Injector Disable test results (Auto Run - Text View)
I6 Injector Disable test results (Auto Run - Graph View)

svcsubproc.para: During Auto Run, injectors are shutoff one at a time (1 through 6 numerical sequence). Base line data and results for each cylinder is displayed in the window (Text View) for I6 Injector Disable test results. Test data for each cylinder can also be viewed by selecting the (Graph View). When finished the engine will return to normal operation.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

svcsubproc.title: Manual Test - Engine Cold
svcsubproc.para: The Manual test is best used when diagnosing each cylinder for cold misfire, considering EOT changes.
The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.
However, when diagnosing a cold misfire, a technician can listen to tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine temperature is 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

svcsubproc.para: Shut off one injector at a time and listen for changes in exhaust tone.

note.para: If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 20 miles before checking for misfire or rough idle.

step1.para: While engine is running, select D_KOER_IDT_I6.ssn from the open session file window and select OPEN to open the session.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following: When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral or park, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from menu bar.
Select I6 Injector Disable Tests from drop down menu.

note.para: The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.
However, when diagnosing a cold misfire, a technician can listen to tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine temperature is 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

step1.para: Select cylinder number and select Run. (Injector selected will be disabled and engine noise should change.)
Select Normal Operation. Injector will be enabled and engine noise should return to previous state of operation.
Repeat steps 4 and 5 for the remaining cylinders.

note.para: Listen for tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.
If any injectors are removed and reinstalled or replaced, test drive vehicle for 20 miles before checking for misfire or rough idle.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.

svcsubproc.title: Manual Test - Engine Hot

note.para: This is an alternate method only. This Manual test should only be used when MasterDiagnostics® software does not have the Automatic test (auto run feature) and the engine is hot.

svcsubproc.para: The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine temperature is 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

svcsubproc.para: Shut off one injector at a time and listen for changes in exhaust tone.

note.para: Do KOER Standard test before doing the I6 Injector Disable test - Run.

step1.para: While engine is running, select D_KOER_IDT_I6.ssn from the open session file window and select OPEN to open the session.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle, when running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from menu bar.
Select I6 Injector Disable Tests from drop down menu.

note.para: The EOT indicator will change from red to green when engine temperature reaches 70 °C (158 °F) or higher.

item.para: If the EOT indicator is red, erroneous comparisons are likely from cylinder to cylinder.
However, when diagnosing a cold misfire, a technician can listen to tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.

When the EOT indicator is green and the engine temperature is 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, fuel rate and timing are more stable, making comparisons from cylinder to cylinder more accurate. Overall engine operation is more stable.

step1.para: Select Collect Data from I6 Injector Disable Diagnostics window. (Baseline values will be shown.)
Record baseline values for EOT, average fuel rate, and average engine load on Diagnostic Form.

note.para: Listen for tone changes from cylinder-to-cylinder.

step1.para: Select cylinder number and select Run. (Injector selected will be disabled and engine tone should change.)
Select Collect Data.
Record values for EOT, average fuel rate, and average engine load on Diagnostic Form.
Select Done to close Collect Data window.
Repeat steps 6 through 9 for the remaining cylinders.
Select Normal Operation
Subtract the baseline for (average fuel rate) from the (average fuel rate) for each injector and record the difference (deviation) on Diagnostic Form.
Add deviations for (average fuel rate) for all injectors and divide by 6. (Round to the nearest tenth - this is the cut off value for fuel rate.)
Record cut off value on Diagnostic Form.
Subtract the baseline for (average engine load) from the (average engine load) for each injector and record the difference (deviation) on Diagnostic Form.
Add deviations for (average engine load) for all injectors and divide by 6. (Round to the nearest tenth - this is the cut off value for engine load.)
Record cut off value on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If deviation values for average fuel rate and average engine load are less than the cut off values for fuel rate and engine load, the injector is suspect for weak cylinder contribution (fuel rate and engine load).
If only one deviation value is less than a cut off value, do not suspect that cylinder.
If a suspect cylinder(s) is identified, do Relative Compression test to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problems.
If the Relative Compression test shows that cylinders are mechanically sound but the Injector Disable test shows that one or more cylinders are bad, replace suspected injector.

step1.para: When finished with this test, select Session from menu bar, then Close.
